items.sentence: I don't think Tom will be going to Australia with Mary.
I don't think Tom knows when Mary will visit Australia.
I don't think Tom knows when Mary will leave Australia.
I didn't know that Tom would be in Australia this week.
I didn't think that Tom would be in Australia all week.
What's wrong with the way we're planning on doing that?
What's the real reason that Tom didn't want to do that?
What's the best advice that anybody has ever given you?
I've done all I can to help you. The rest is up to you.
Tom was walking home alone at night when he got mugged.
Tom was doing something he wasn't supposed to be doing.
Tom says he changes his password at least once a month.
Tom doesn't know how long he'll need to stay in Boston.
We couldn't get everything done that needed to be done.
The fact that Tom likes the idea isn't relevant at all.
Tom couldn't see who it was that was talking with Mary.
It's so awful that I don't even want to think about it.
The lightbulb wasn't invented by perfecting the candle.
I don't think Tom knows what Mary is making for dinner.
I don't think that you're trying very hard to find Tom.
I don't think you need to tell Tom what you plan to do.
I don't think you need to tell Tom what he needs to do.
I don't think you need to tell Tom why Mary isn't here.
I don't think Tom will be thrilled about what happened.
I don't think anyone really thought that Tom was happy.
I don't think anybody really thought that Tom was busy.
Mary hung her grandfather's picture over the fireplace.
Mary stood as still as a statue when she saw the snake.
No one knows just how many people died in the accident.
I need to finish this book before the end of the month.
You think Tom could've done that on his own, don't you?
Tom doesn't know how to do what you've asked him to do.
I wonder what Tom would be like if he were still alive.
Things weren't going as badly as Tom thought they were.
Tom tried to talk Mary into driving him to the airport.
In most cases, any decision is better than no decision.
If you aren't careful, the cops are going to catch you.
Tom wasn't the first person to encourage me to do that.
Tom is fortunate his house wasn't damaged by the storm.
I didn't think something like that would embarrass Tom.
I don't want to drive. Maybe Tom wouldn't mind driving.
Tom and Mary were both very skinny when they were kids.
Did you know that Tom was planning on moving to Boston?
My brother is very important. At least he thinks he is.
I don't think it was fair for Tom to get all the money.
Tom went on doing that even though we asked him not to.
Why is it easier to stay up late than to wake up early?
Tom drank the glass of champagne that was given to him.
I'm afraid that Tom is going to drink himself to death.
No sooner had I left the house than it started to rain.
